title: The young-mans repentance, or, The sorrowful sinners lamentation; being the last expressions of a young-man, who having spent all his time in pleasure and jollitry, was seriously sorrowful when he came to lye upon his death-bed, mourning for his mis-spent time, and advising all young-men to be mindful of their latter end. Tune is, Aim not too high. This may be printed, R.P.
publicationStmtPublisher: Printed for J. Back, at the Black-Boy, on London,
